de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup

Class GridSetupActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • android.support.v4.app.SupportActivity
              • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
                • de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup.GridSetupActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, FragmentChangeListener

    public class GridSetupActivity
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
implements FragmentChangeListener
    This is the primary FragmentActivity for the Initial Setup of the Coordinate System. To setup the Floe's Coordinate System two Fixed/Base Stations need to installed. For details on the Coordinate System and how it's setup check the Floe Navigation System Guides.

    The activity's own layout is empty containing only a single FrameLayout. The Fragments MMSIFragment and CoordinateFragment run on top of this Activity to install the first two Fixed/Base Stations on which the Coordinate System is setup.

    The icons shown on the Action Bar and the Up button on the screen depend on the running fragment. The Backbutton, Action Bar icons and Up Button are disabled in the fragment CoordinateFragment and are enabled in MMSIFragment.

    See Also:
    DatabaseHelper, SetupActivity, de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup

    • Field Detail

      • configSetupStep

        private boolean configSetupStep
        Variable to check which step of the Initial Setup Configuration is running. true when MMSIFragment has run and now CoordinateFragment has to be loaded. Not used completely in this version.

      • TAG

        private static final java.lang.String TAG
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • dstAddress

        public static final java.lang.String dstAddress
        Default IP Address/Hostname of the AIS Transponder with which the App will try to make a Telnet Connection to read the incoming AIS Data Stream. Used by NetworkMonitor and AISMessageReceiver to create a Telnet Connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • dstPort

        public static final int dstPort
        Default Port on the AIS Transponder with which the App will try to make a Telnet Connection to read the incoming AIS Data Stream. Used by NetworkMonitor and AISMessageReceiver to create a Telnet Connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • onStart

        protected void onStart()
        Called when the activity is about to start, it sets ActionBar icons on the screen by calling the actionBarUpdatesFunction().
        Overrides:
        onStart in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

      • actionBarUpdatesFunction

        private void actionBarUpdatesFunction()
        Registers and implements the BroadcastReceivers for the AIS Connectivity and GPS location broadcasts; which are sent from NetworkMonitor and GPS_Service respectively. The GPS Broadcast receiver sets the value of locationStatus to the value from the GPS_Service. The AIS Connectivity broadcast receiver sets the boolean packetStatus. This also registers Runnable with the Handler statusHandler which runs at a regular interval specified by ActionBarActivity.UPDATE_TIME and it checks the booleans locationStatus and packetStatus and changes the Action Bar icons for GPS and AIS Connectivity accordingly.
        See Also:
        Runnable, Handler, BroadcastReceiver, ActionBarActivity

      • replaceFragment

        public void replaceFragment(android.support.v4.app.Fragment fragment)

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called before FragmentActivity.onStop(). Saves the value of configSetupStep in a Bundle so that if the App is run again it will load the correct Fragment.
        Overrides:
        onSaveInstanceState in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu)
        Creates the Action Bar icons on top of the screen. By default it shows the GPS icon, AIS Connectivity icon and the Grid Setup icon.
        Overrides:
        onCreateOptionsMenu in class android.app.Activity

      • onStop

        protected void onStop()
        Called when the Activity is no longer Visible on the screen. It unregisters the AIS and GPS BroadcastReceivers.
